kgcnn.utils package¶

Submodules¶

kgcnn.utils.activ module¶

kgcnn.utils.activ.leaky_softplus(alpha=0.3)¶

Leaky softplus activation function similar to leakyRELU but smooth.

Parameters

alpha (float, optional) – Leaking slope. The default is 0.3.

Returns

lambda function of x.

Return type

func

kgcnn.utils.activ.shifted_softplus(x)¶

Shifted softplus activation function.

Parameters

x – single values to apply activation to using tf.keras functions

Returns

log(exp(x)+1) - log(2)

Return type

out

kgcnn.utils.activ.softplus2(x)¶

out = log(exp(x)+1) - log(2) softplus function that is 0 at x=0, the implementation aims at avoiding overflow

Parameters

x – (Tensor) input tensor

Returns

output tensor

Return type

Tensor

kgcnn.utils.adj module¶

kgcnn.utils.adj.add_self_loops_to_indexlist(indices)¶

Add self-loops to edge index list, i.e. [[0,0],[1,1]…] and sort the final output.

Note: It applies unique to the index list, removes duplicate edges.

Parameters

indices (np.array) – Index list of shape (N,3).

Returns

Sorted index list with self-loops.

Return type

out_indices (np.array)

kgcnn.utils.adj.indexlist_sort(indexlist, vals)¶

Sort index list.

Parameters

  • indexlist (np.array) – Edge indices.

  • vals (np.array) – Edge values.

Returns

[ind,val]

  • ind (np.array): Sorted indices.

  • val (np.array): Edge values matching sorted indices.

Return type

list

kgcnn.utils.adj.make_undirected(A)¶

Make adjacency matrix undirected. This adds edges if directed.

Parameters

A (np.array,scipy.sparse) – Adjacency matrix.

Returns

undirected Adjacency matrix. This has A=A^T.

Return type

(np.array,scipy.sparse)

kgcnn.utils.adj.precompute_adjacency_scaled(A, add_identity=True)¶

Precompute the scaled adjacency matrix A_scaled = D^-0.5 (A + I) D^-0.5.

Parameters

  • A (np.array,scipy.sparse) – Adjacency matrix of shape (N,N).

  • add_identity (bool, optional) – Whether to add identity. Defaults to True.

Returns

D^-0.5 (A + I) D^-0.5.

Return type

np.array

kgcnn.utils.adj.scaled_adjacency_to_list(Ascaled)¶

Map adjacency matrix to index list plus edge weights.

Parameters

Ascaled (np.array,scipy.sparse) – Scaled Adjacency matrix of shape (N,N). A_scaled = D^-0.5 (A + I) D^-0.5.

Returns

[edge_index, edge_weight]

  • edge_index (np.array): Indexlist of shape (N,2).

  • edge_weight (np.array): Entries of Adjacency matrix of shape (N,N)

Return type

list

kgcnn.utils.data module¶

kgcnn.utils.data.load_list(fname)¶

Load a pickled list from file.

Parameters

fname (str) – Filepath to load.

Returns

Pickle object.

Return type

outlist (list)

kgcnn.utils.data.save_list(outlist, fname)¶

Save a pickled list to file.

Parameters

  • outlist (list) – List of eg. np.arrays.

  • fname (str) – Filepath to save.

Returns

None.

kgcnn.utils.learning module¶

kgcnn.utils.learning.lr_lin_reduction(learning_rate_start=0.001, learning_rate_stop=1e-05, epo=10000, epomin=1000)¶

Make learning rate schedule function for linear reduction.

Parameters

  • learning_rate_start (float, optional) – Learning rate to start with. The default is 1e-3.

  • learning_rate_stop (float, optional) – Final learning rate at the end of epo. The default is 1e-5.

  • epo (int, optional) – Total number of epochs to reduce learning rate towards. The default is 10000.

  • epomin (int, optional) – Minimum number of epochs at beginning to leave learning rate constant. The default is 1000.

Returns

Function to use with LearningRateScheduler.

Return type

func

Example

lr_schedule_lin = tf.keras.callbacks.LearningRateScheduler(lr_lin_reduction)

kgcnn.utils.loader module¶

class kgcnn.utils.loader.GraphLoaderList(label, node, edge_index, edge, state, batch_size=32, shuffle=False, input_type='ragged', output_embedd='graph', output_type='padded')¶

Bases: tensorflow.python.keras.utils.data_utils.Sequence

Data loader for graphs using tensorflow.keras.utils.Sequence.

Note: Not tested yet.

on_epoch_end()¶

Updates indexes after each epoch.
